text: this dish is called the Hainan chicken
and Hainan is the southeastern most part
of China very close to Vietnam although
the dish has nothing in common with
Vietnamese cooking what it does have is
a history of migration from Hainan to
Los Angeles where it's all over the
place and where I found it to here where
I've brought it it's very simple you put
a chicken in the pot basically with
water to cover ginger and garlic maybe
some scallion a touch of soy and you
poach it for 10 minutes 15 minutes not
very long at a very gentle simmer then
you put the top on and walk away for
about an hour when it's ready it's gonna
be quite tender and easy to take off the
bone
not quite falling off the bone you want
to be able to remove it from the pot and
what you're doing now is cooking rice in
the broth that the chicken created so
need a pan with some hot oil or as I
said chicken fat or both in a peanut oil
if you're using oil and into this you're

you want it sizzling needs to be a
